content: Write a limerick about video games in the style of Lewis Carroll.

In a land where the pixels gleam bright,  
A young gamer with joy took delight.  
With controller in hand,  
He explored foreign lands,  
In this digital realm, all was right.  
  
But one day, a glitch did appear,  
A surreal twist, quite unclear.  
The characters spoke in rhyme,  
In a world of pure delight,  
Where nonsense and logic did conspire.  
  
Cheshire cats with controllers grinned,  
While Mad Hatters puzzles combined.  
Down the rabbit hole he fell,  
Into a game that time did dispel,  
In this Carrollian video twirl.  
  
So if you should find yourself in a game,  
Where logic and madness do the same,  
Just remember to play,  
With a heart full of glee,  
For in this world, madness is fame.
